solution.text:
Percentage of pencils = \(\frac{x}{200+x} \times 100 \)
Therefore , \( _{j}_ = \frac{100x}{200 + x} \)
_{{100-j}}_\(x\) =_{{200*j}}_
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore \(x\) = _{{200*j/(100-j)}}_

content.text: Ram thinks about doing a mathematical experiment. He takes 200 pens and mixes them with '\(x\)' number of pencils. He observes that the percentage of pencils is _{j}_%.  What is the value of \(x\)?
